review: I gave away my Roku a year ago and found a need for another way to stream Netflix.  I also have two streaming. Blu-Ray players! a Wii and a tv with a dongle.  By far, the Apple TV is my favorite tool for streaming.  As it's dedicated to the task, there's MUCH Less wait time during applications.  Turn on the tv, turn on the Apple device, and there's a menu.  Click Netflix and the connection is speed.  Also, browsing titles is optimized.  A couple minuses-- the mirror function is hit or miss, sometimes it just stops working and sometimes, the icon disappears.  Also, as far as Netflix is concerned, it doesn't keep track of titles I've rated.  Sure, the stars are there, but they're not red for unrated and gold for rated.  I've started a couple movies to realize I'd seen them before.
